description: Installation of 0.9m high electronic steel sliding vehicle access gate with four 1m high brick piers; installation of 0.45m high low brick wall with 0.45m railing top to front boundary; extension of hardsurfacing to front; vehicle access
decision_conditions: Prior to the commencement of the development hereby approved (including any ground clearance, tree works, demolition or construction), details of all tree protection monitoring and site supervision by a suitably qualified tree specialist (where arboricultural expertise is required) shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. The development thereafter shall be implemented in strict accordance with the approved details.

Prior to the
commencement of the development hereby approved (including demolition and all
preparatory work), the following should be submitted for approval in writing: 
 Specification of the
     CellWeb no-dig driveway to be installed within the RPA of existing
     retained trees, based on the generic recommendations made within the
     approved impact assessment and TPP / AMS. Details should include levels
     and cross-sections where relevant, and take into account the raised levels
     across the site where they meet with any adjacent building damp proof
     courses. No-dig driveway must be installed by competent personnel / the
     manufacturers’ contractors.
NB: The proposed CellPave
is neither no-dig nor is it acceptable for use near to existing trees.

Notwithstanding the plans submitted and any annotations made, anything
installed within the Root Protection Area of existing trees must be a ‘no-dig’ cellular
confinement system which involves no excavation into the underlying soil and
protects existing root system.
The mechanism for opening of the proposed vehicular access gates shall be inward sliding into the application site and not outward.

The materials to be used in the construction of the development hereby permitted shall be as specified within the approved plans and/or application form, unless otherwise approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority.

<p>The development hereby permitted shall be carried out in accordance with the following documents and plans:&nbsp;</p><ul><li>Site Location Plan entitled Planning Portal Ref No: PP-12883445v1;</li><li>Existing/Proposed Site Plan entitled Drawing No. LaVaastu/2023/319/02;</li><li>Existing/Proposed Boundary Wall Plan/Elevation entitled Drawing No. LaVaastu/2023/319/03;</li><li>Reasonable Exception Statement received on 22.04.2024;</li><li>Arboricultural Impact Assessment Ref: BPC 20993;</li></ul>

The development hereby permitted
shall be begun before the expiration of three years from the date of this
permission.
